intro: Draba cajamarcensis, commonly known as the Cajamarca bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as mountainous grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, round seed pods that release seeds when mature. Draba cajamarcensis is notable for its adaptability to harsh, cold climates and its role in local ecosystems.
